BCG vaccine was included into the Expanded Programme on Immunization (EPI) (WHO) in 1974, and has been used as the primary TB vaccine since then. Every year, around 100 million children are given BCG vaccine worldwide.
45, 46 Among children, BCG prevents infection by most of the severe forms of TB, and reduces the incidence of miliary and meningeal TB by around 85% and TB-related deaths by 66%.
47, 48 BCG has been prescribed during childhood in nations having a high burden of TB for decades. Currently, 152 low- and middle-income countries (LMIC) have adopted universal child vaccination policy at birth or in the first week of birth.
